articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un discussed practical issues in stepping up military cooperation with Russia's defence minister, state KCNA news agency said on Sunday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim discusses stronger ties with Russian defence minister, KCNA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane crash in Brazil's northern Amazon state on Saturday has left 14 dead, the state's governor said.
articles.title: Plane crash in Brazil's Amazon state leaves 14 dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: On his first trip to Cuba during his third term in office, Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva called the embargo imposed by the United States on the island "illegal" and denounced the island's inclusion on the list of state sponsors of terrorism.
articles.title: Brazil's president calls U.S. economic embargo on Cuba 'illegal,' condemns terrorist list label

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: U.N. nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi on Saturday condemned Iran's "disproportionate and unprecedented" move to bar multiple inspectors assigned to the country, hindering its oversight of Tehran's atomic activities.
articles.title: IAEA chief Grossi condemns Iran's 'unprecedented' barring of inspectors

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of supporters of a pro-Russian Czech opposition party gathered in Prague on Saturday to protest against the country's centre-right government, criticising its economic management and military support for Ukraine.
articles.title: Czech protesters rally against government's pro-Western policies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso, three West African Sahel nations ruled by military juntas, signed a security pact on Saturday promising to come to the aid of each other in case of any rebellion or external aggression.
articles.title: Mali, Niger and Burkina Faso sign Sahel security pact

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: British comedian and actor Russell Brand has denied any criminal wrongdoing as the Sunday Times newspaper reported four women had accused him of sexual assaults, including rape, during a seven-year period when he was at the height of his fame.
articles.title: UK comedian Russell Brand denies media allegations of sex assaults

articles.author: Greg Torode, Martin Pollard
articles.description: The disappearance of China's defence minister, the latest in a string of upheavals in the country's top ranks, is stoking uncertainty about President Xi Jinping's rule as an internal security clampdown trumps international engagement.
articles.title: Upheavals in Xi's world spread concern about China's diplomacy

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: Talks between the United Auto Workers and the Detroit Three automakers resumed on Saturday, a day after the union began its first simultaneous strikes at three U.S. auto plants.
articles.title: UAW, automakers resume labor talks; Stellantis hikes wage offer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's air forces thwarted a coordinated Ukrainian attack on Crimea early on Sunday, destroying at least six drones that were targeting the peninsula from different directions, the Russian defence ministry said.
articles.title: Russia says it thwarted Ukraine drone attacks on Crimea
